title: Installation issue "libsigsegv"
body:
Dear community,

I´ll try to install dealii onto a Ubuntu 16.04.6 LTS machine with gcc 5.4.0 and the build runs into an error while installing "libsigsegv".
It´s indepentend whether a user or the super user run the installation and there isn´t also a problem with permissions. On tests with other machine with same OS and gcc, I have partial success with the installation, otherwise it runs into the same error.

It also happens when I try to install gnuplot or a spack env provided gcc version.

Thank you very much in advance for your help.

Kind regards,
Christian



### Steps to reproduce the issue

```console
$ spack install dealii

==> Installing libsigsegv
==> Searching for binary cache of libsigsegv
==> Warning: No Spack mirrors are currently configured
==> No binary for libsigsegv found: installing from source
==> Using cached archive: /calculate/temp/test/spack/var/spack/cache/libsigsegv/libsigsegv-2.11.tar.gz
==> Staging archive: /tmp/root/spack-stage/libsigsegv-2.11-al7rbv44djfwdk5g7jet2b7pki63klw6/libsigsegv-2.11.tar.gz
==> Created stage in /tmp/root/spack-stage/libsigsegv-2.11-al7rbv44djfwdk5g7jet2b7pki63klw6
==> No patches needed for libsigsegv
==> Building libsigsegv [AutotoolsPackage]
==> Executing phase: 'autoreconf'
==> Executing phase: 'configure'
==> Error: ProcessError: Command exited with status 77:
    '/tmp/root/spack-stage/libsigsegv-2.11-al7rbv44djfwdk5g7jet2b7pki63klw6/spack-src/configure' '--prefix=/calculate/temp/test/spack/opt/spack/linux-ubuntu16.04-skylake/gcc-5.4.0/libsigsegv-2.11-al7rbv44djfwdk5g7jet2b7pki63klw6' '--enable-shared'

2 errors found in build log:
     8     checking for a thread-safe mkdir -p... /bin/mkdir -p
     9     checking for gawk... gawk
     10    checking whether make sets $(MAKE)... yes
     11    checking whether make supports nested variables... yes
     12    checking for gcc... /calculate/temp/test/spack/lib/spack/env/gcc/gcc
     13    checking whether the C compiler works... no
  >> 14    configure: error: in `/tmp/root/spack-stage/libsigsegv-2.11-al7rbv44djfwdk5g7jet2b7pki63klw6/spack-src':
  >> 15    configure: error: C compiler cannot create executables
     16    See `config.log' for more details

See build log for details:
  /tmp/root/spack-stage/libsigsegv-2.11-al7rbv44djfwdk5g7jet2b7pki63klw6/spack-build-out.txt

```

The same error happens when installing gnuplot or gcc within spack environment.

### Platform and user environment

```commandline
$ uname -a 
Linux fautm101 4.4.0-164-generic #192-Ubuntu SMP Fri Sep 13 12:02:50 UTC 2019 x86_64 x86_64 x86_64 GNU/Linux
$ lsb_release -d
Description:    Ubuntu 16.04.6 LTS
``` 

- `compilers.yaml`
```commandline
compilers:
- compiler:
    environment: {}
    extra_rpaths: []
    flags: {}
    modules: []
    operating_system: ubuntu16.04
    paths:
      cc: /usr/bin/gcc
      cxx: /usr/bin/g++
      f77: /usr/bin/gfortran
      fc: /usr/bin/gfortran
    spec: gcc@5.4.0
    target: x86_64
```
